metadata.title: CVE-2023-52515 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/srp: Do not call scsi_done() from srp_abort() Afterscmd_eh_abort_handler() has called the SCSI LLD eh_abort_handler callback,it performs one of the following actions: * Call scsi_queue_insert(). *Call scsi_finish_command(). * Call scsi_eh_scmd_add(). Hence, SCSI aborthandlers must not call scsi_done(). Otherwise all the above actions wouldtrigger a use-after-free. Hence remove the scsi_done() call fromsrp_abort(). Keep the srp_free_req() call before returning SUCCESS becausewe may not see the command again if SUCCESS is returned.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
